comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This same May's postcard is captioned "A Bleriot monoplane on the ground at Aldershot with several onlookers." on the Imperial War Museums site. www.iwm.org.uk/collections/item/object/205192450 This could be a Blériot XI en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bl%C3%A9riot_XI I.C.S. was International Correspondence Schools, Ltd. of London, which in 1912 sponsored an Aviation Tour of Great Britain, with Robert Slack piloting a Bleriot. www.flightglobal.com/pdfarchive/view/1912/1912%20-%200560... Ephemeral Link: www.ebay.com/itm/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=15049...
